newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian mining/metal trade union to protest Mar 27.
newsitem.headline: Russian mining/metal trade union to protest Mar 27.

text.p: Russia's Mining and Metallurgical Trade Union, with two million members, will join a nationwide day of protest on March 27, union president Mikhail Tarasenko was quoted by Interfax news agency as saying on Friday.
The action, under the slogan "for work, pay and social guarantees", would will involve protests, marches and pickets.
Tarasenko was quoted as saying that a few unnamed enterprises would strike on March 27, but he gave no details.
Russia has hundreds of ferrous and non-ferrous metals outfits, and many workers are upset about arrears.
Salary arrears to non-ferrous metals and gold-producing workers had risen to 2.05 trillion roubles by the end of February from less than one trillion roubles in March 1996.
Arrears to ferrous metal-producing sectors had risen to 1.53 trillion roubles from from 0.46 trillion over the same period.
"The situation is totally intolerable," Tarasenko said.
